text:
:hand:
HubSpot speed optimization best practices? anyone know ?
look at the HubSpot developer youtube channel! There are a couple of videos on it

the 3 most surface level things you can use (that are documented in hs docs)
1. `resize_image_url()` function (and optimize your images before you even use this function)
2. `require_js()` function (with async and footer placement args)
3. `require_css()` function (use async option for non critical css)

<@U011U4A6TNY>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed>
is it possible to limit the loading of HubSpot scripts?

Certain scripts appear only when you use certain features. Like forms, CTAs.

The analytics script will always load.
make it sense, but the forms/v2.js script is loaded although there is no form on the page
I did everytnhing as described in the article
Additionaly I loads directly in DOM all modules styles in head and all custom scripts in end body (limited number of requests)
and I have a problem getting a score > 60 (for mobile)
any idea?
Could you post the link to the site? (If it’s a live website) that way folks can see what improvements can be made.
<https://www.ideamotive.co/>
Anyone know if we can disable author page URLs? is there a setting somewhere to turn them off?
and then create redirects if anyone tries to go to `/author/*`
One of our team members is seeing this in a client portal. Does this mean all follow-up emails are going to quit working?

it’s all of your tracking scripts <@U011U4A6TNY>.
Disable FB, hotjar, gtm, and google analytics and see what your score is
Also, are you using and page cache breaking hubl? i.e. any `{{ request }}`code or `|random` filters, etc?

Appreciate you chiming in John. I keep getting pulled in a fair amount of directions today and hadn’t had time to give enough of a detailed look.

What I was able to get in the time I’ve had to look at it is that Total Blocking Time is the area of biggest improvement. Which basically does indeed amount to javascript primarily.

There are indeed a fair amount of tracking scripts, including it looked like there may be more than 1 Google Tag manager script (it showed in page speed insights, didn’t look in the HTML by hand). Tracking scripts are often heavy culprits in TBT -  which makes sense: To work all of these analytics scripts set up a ton of event handlers that every time an event fires that they’re interested in, each of these scripts separately has JavaScript run to log and handle that event.

The contentListTalent module seems to be where the forms script is coming from.  I believe that the form script may be getting loaded as a result of the form tag being in the module.

It’s difficult to really dig into as there’s a lot of files imported into that module, so the form tag itself within the module is likely being included from one of those maybe via a macro.
For reference for folks trying to troubleshoot what module is loading a script. You can see it by using `?hsDebug=True` and inspecting the page. A little HTML comment will appear.

related, if you use hsDebug=True, and you look at the large debug comment toward the bottom of the page you’ll see a lot of warnings. Most of these should show within the Design Manager or module editor as well. Resolving them may help server-side performance for all pages using this template, and any modules that are affected.

Hey <@UB690RZA7>, please reach out to support via the account experiencing this. You can also send me that account’s portal id and I will make a note in the ticket for the support person that may speed up things up.

I think this is related to a feature rollout and the wording of the warning notice maybe could have been written more clearly. Given the potential immediate nature of resolving the follow-up email situation. The support person will be able to better direct you and answer any questions.
Thanks, Jon. DM’ing you.
<@U3T21PDBK> thanks for answer. I know about external marketing scripts, but i’m concerned about HubSpot internals
<@U7SL518D6> you’re right, forms is used on contentlisttalent module, I missed it somewhere
I forgot about the query string hsDebug = True so  I try fix all errors
I have one more question
is it possible to use Gatsby with a hotspot?
or some other tool to generate static files?

No need really. We prerender your pages. Which basically means visitors are served static versions of the files from the CDN.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/cdn/prerendering>
